abstract: Miss World pageant organizers give Canadian contestant Anastasia Lin permission to speak to news media; Lin had angered Chinese government after speaking publicly about government-backed transplant programs in China, which human rights advocates say rely on organs harvested from prisoners.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: Pageant organizers gave Anastasia Lin permission on Wednesday to speak to the news media, ending a three-week standoff over her criticism of human rights abuses in China.
snippet: Pageant organizers gave Anastasia Lin permission on Wednesday to speak to the news media, ending a three-week standoff over her criticism of human rights abuses in China....

headline.main: Miss World Contestant Who Challenged China Is Allowed to Speak Once More
headline.print_headline: Pageant Contestant Who Riled China Is Unmuzzled
